intro: Henckelia dasii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that help it store water, adapting it to its often-dry habitat. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-draining soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native regions.
